head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 5 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Gregory of Nyssa. Fragments of the Commentary of Gregory Nyssen on the Song of Songs. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Fragments of the Commentary of Gregory Nyssen on the Song of Songs
Part of hom. xv.
msItem.note:
See Opera, ed. 1638, t. i. p. 703, A, line 5, ὅταν ἐν καιρῷ ἀνοίχηται τὸ στόμα τοῦ λόγου, as far as p. 709, A, line 9, διὰ τὸν τῆς ὀγδόης φόβον, κ. τ. λ.
.

msItem.title: Part of a homily expounding ch. vi. 10-viii. 14
msItem.note: This homily is not found either in the edition of 1638 , or in Migne's Patrol. Gr. The portion extant commences with the explanation of ch. vi. 12.

physDesc.p: Four vellum leaves, 13 1/4 in. by 10 1/8, each page of which has three columns, and each column from 49 to 54 lines. The writing is a neat, regular Estrangělā of the vith cent.

layout.p: Each page has three columns, and each column from 49 to 54 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a neat, regular Estrangělā of the vith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Evagrius of Pontus. Fragments of the works of Evagrius. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 10 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Fragments of the works of Evagrius
Life of Evagrius
msItem.rubric: ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܕܘܒܪ̈ܘܗܝ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܛܘܒܢܐ̇. ܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܕܒܡܨܪܝܢ

msItem.title: A tract entitled "of asceticism"
msItem.note: This tract is a translation of the tractatus ad Eulogium, but different from that in Add. 14,578, no. 3 .

msItem.title: A tract entitled of the perfect life
msItem.note: Imperfect both at the beginning and the end.

msItem.title: The conclusion of the six centuries
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡܘ ܩ̈ܦܠܐܐ ܫܬܡܐܐ ܕܥܠ ܐܝܕܥܬܐ̣. ܕܫܬ ܡܐ̈ܘܬܐ.
msItem.note: See Add. 14,578, no. 31, from fol. 143b to the end .

msItem.title: Part of Fragments of the works of Evagrius
msItem.rubric: ܦܘܢܝ ܦ̈ܬܓܡܐ ܕܡܢ ܟܬ̈ܒܝ ܩܘܕܫܐ̣ ܠܘܩܒܠ ܕܝ̈ܘܐ ܕܡܢܣܝܢ ܠܢ

msItem.title: Part of the tract on the thoughts that are opposed to a pious life
A tract
msItem.explicit: ܗܟܢܐ ܕܝܢ ܐܦ ܫܝܛܘܬܐ ܘܨܥܪܐ ܘܥܩܬܐ̣ ܡܐܣܝܢ ܠܪܡܘܬܐ.

msItem.title: Part of Fragments of the works of Evagrius
A tract
msItem.incipit: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܡܟܝܟܘܬܗ ܝܗ̇ܒ ܩܢܘܡܗ ܕܢܗܘܐ ܥܒ̣ܕܐ ܠܐܚܪܢܐ̣. ܕܡ̇ܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܡ̇ܟܟ ܢܦܫܗ̇. ܘܫܩ̣ܠ ܕܡܘܬܗ ܕܥܒ̣ܕܐ

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 12 1/8 in. by 9 1/2, consisting of 11 leaves (Add. 14,635, foll. 5—15), several of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 5, 10, 11, 14, and 15. There are lacunae after foll. 5, 6, 9, 11, 12, 13, and 14. Each page is divided into 3 columns, of from 36 to 40 lines. The writing is a fine, regular Estrangělā of the vith cent.

item.p: Several of the leaves are much stained and torn, especially foll.5, 10, 11, 14, and 15.
There are lacunae after foll.5, 6, 9, 11, 12, 13, and 14.

layout.p: Each page is divided into 3 columns, of from 36 to 40 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangělā of the vith cent.

item.p: On fol. 5a there is a note, stating that the priest John, the son of Macarius, abbat of the Syrians in the desert of Scete, helped to bind this book,A. Gr. 1205, A.D. 894.

p.quote: ܐܫܬܘܬܦ ܒܕܘܒܩܐ ܗܢܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܚܛܝܐ ܘܒܨܝܪܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܒܪ ܡܩܪܝ ܪܝܫ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܣܩܝܛܝܣ. ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܗ̣ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܏ܘܫ. ܟܬܒܬܝ (sic) ܗܠܝܢ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܡܬܝܢ ܏ܘܗ ♰

item.label: Colophon
item.p: Underneath this, the same John has written in Coptic:

p.quote: I pray the God of my fathers, remember my littleness, IJohn the little, priest, son of....Macarius.....(?). May Christ Jesus our Lord forgive me all my sins, because I have laboured at this holy book of AbbaEvagrius.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Ephrem the Syrian. Metrical discourses of Ephraim, 330 in number. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 6 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Metrical discourses of Ephraim, 330 in number.
msItem.note: If fol.18 really belongs to the same manuscript as foll.16 and 17, these leaves are all that are left of a large volume.

msItem.title: Madrāshē on the Church
msItem.rubric: ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܥܠ ܥܕܬܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ̈ܝܢ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ̣. ܥܠ ܩܠܐ ܕܒܟ ܗܘ ܡܪܝ ܡܬܚ̇ܨܦ ܐܢܐ
msItem.incipit: ܐ̣ܣܓܐ ܠܢ ܡܪܝ ܒܘܝܢܐ̣. ܕܚܢܩܘܗܝ ܚܘ̈ܒܐ ܠܒܘܝܢܢ.
msItem.note: The first madrāshē is the only one remaining, beginning on fol.16b.

msItem.title: Part of Metrical discourses of Ephraim, 330 in number.
Madrāshā
msItem.incipit: ܐܡܛܪ ܡܪܝ ܠܬܪܥܝܬܝ̣ ܫ̈ܦܥܐ ܕܡܛܪܟ ܒܪܝܟܐ.

msItem.title: Madrāshā
msItem.incipit: ܐܡܪ ܐܢ ܗ̣ܘ ܕܫܠܝܛ ܕܢܗܠܠ: ܦܘܡܐ ܕܠܐ ܩܕܝܫ ܕܢܫ̇ܒܚ.

msItem.title: Madrāshā to the same tune.
msItem.incipit: ܐܬܕܟ̣ܪܘ ܐܚ̈ܝ ܗܫܐ ܐܝܟܐ ܐܢܬܘܢ. ܘܠܡܚܪ ܬܘܒ ܐܝܟܐ ܗ̇ܘܝܢ ܚܢܢ

physDesc.p: Three vellum leaves, about 13 ¼ in. by 10, all slightly stained and torn (Add. 14,635, foll. 16—18). There are three columns, of from 38 to 42 lines, in each page. The writing is a good, regular Estrangela of the vith cent., the probable date being A.D. 555. If fol. 18 really belongs to the same manuscript as foll. 16 and 17, these leaves are all that are left of a large volume

item.p: All of the leaves are slightly stained and torn.
The first column of fol.18a has been cut away.

layout.p: There are three columns, of from 38 to 42 lines, in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a good, regular Estrangela of the vith cent., the probable date being A.D.555.

item.label: Colophon
Doxology
item.p: The first column of fol. 18a has been cut away. The second contains the conclusion of the colophon:

p.quote: ܕܣܝܟܝܢ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܘܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܬܠܬܡܐܐ ܘܬܠܬܝܢ. ܟܬܝܒܝܢ ܘܡܦܚܡܝܢ ܒܫܩܠܛܥܢܐ. ܫܘܒܚܐ ܠܐܒܐ ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: Then follows a note, written in a smaller and more cursive character, stating that this manuscript was purchased by one Alexander, a monk of the convent of Sergius at —, A. Gr.866, A.D.555.

p.quote: ܢܗܘܐ ܕܘܟܪܢܐ ܛܒܐ ܩܕܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܡܫܝܚܗ ܘܪܘܚܗ ܚܝܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܐ ܠܒܨܝܪܐ ܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܐ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܡܪܝ ܣܪܓܝܣ . . . ܐ ܕܐܬܚܦܛ ܘܙܒܢ ܠܗ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܡܢ ܕܝܠܗ ܘܡܢ ܡܪ̈ܗܛܘܗܝ ܠܦܘܪܩܢܐ ܕܚ̈ܝܘܗܝ ܘܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܚܒ̈ܝܒܘܗܝ. ܏ܘܫ. ܙܒܝܢܐ ܕܝܢ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܫܢܬ ܬܡܢܡܐܐ ܘܫܬܝܢ ܘܫܬ ܒܐܝܪܚ ܟܢܘܢ ܩܕܝܡ.

item.p: The third column of the same page contains two notes, the first of which records the presentation of the book to the convent of — by the priest —, of the convent of Naphshāthā, in the time of the abbat Thomas.

p.quote: ܐܫܬܟܢ ܘܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܝܘܡܢܐ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ . . . ܕܐܫܬܟܢ ܡܢ ܡܢܚ ܢܦܫܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ . . . ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܢܦܫ̈ܬܐ ܒܝ̈ܘܡܘܗܝ ܕܪܚܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ[ܪܝܫ]ܕܝܪܐ ܡܪܝ ܬܐܘܡܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܕܝܪܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: The other note is not quite so legible, but it shows that the book belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara in the time of the abbat Salībā, when Abraham (or Ephraim) was patriarch of Alexandria (i.e. A.D.977-981; See Renaudot, Hist. patr. Jacob. Alexandr., p. 366 , and Le Quien, Or. Christ., t. ii. col. 476 ).

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܩܕ[ܝܫܐ]ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܡܠܦܢܐ . . . ܐܒ̇݅ܪܗܡ ܦܛܝܪܟܝܣ (sic) ܒܝܘ̈ܡܝ ܨܠܝܒܐ ܪܝܫܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܣܩܝܛܐ. ܟܠ ܕܡܦܩ ܠܗ ܡܢ ܡܕܒܪܐܬܚܬܚܪܡܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܐܡܝܢ.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Basil of Caesarea. Part of the second book of the treatise of Basil againstEunomius. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of the second book of the treatise of Basil against Eunomius
msItem.note: See Opera (Paris, 1839), t. i., p. 353, line 2 , τῆς ἀρχῆς ταύτης• Οὖ γὰρ τὴν ἀπὸ χρόνου ὕπαρξιν τὸ ἦν ὐποφαίνει, κ.τ.λ., as far as p. 357, line 38, Ὡς γὰρ ἐκεῖ ἀνόητον τὸ ἐρώτημα, ἐπὶ τοῦ ἀνάρχου καὶ ἀγεννήτου ζητεῖν τὸ ἀνώτερον; and p. 367, line 23, τοῦ κατὰ φύσιν Ὑιοῦ, κ.τ.λ., as far as page 372, line 3, τὸ σκότος πάντως• Εἰ τοίνυν ὄσον.

physDesc.p: Two vellum leaves, about 13 ¼ in. by 10, both much torn. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 45 to 48 lines. The writing is good and regular, of the viiith or ixth cent.

item.p: Both of the leaves are much torn.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 45 to 48 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is good and regular, of the viiith or ixth cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Lessons from the Gospels for Passion Holy Week. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 5 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Lessons from the Gospels for Passion (or Holy) Week

physDesc.p: Four vellum leaves, about 12 5/8 in. by 10, all slightly stained and torn (Add. 14,635, foll. 21—24 ). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 26 to 30 lines. There is a lacuna between foll. 22 and 23. The writing is a stiff, regular Estrangela, probably of the xith cent.

item.p: All of the leaves are slightly stained and torn.
There is a lacuna between foll.22 and 23.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 26 to 30 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a stiff, regular Estrangela, probably of the xith cent.

decoDesc.decoNote: Several of the rubrics are ornamented with gilding.
The word ܡܬܝ is written with blue paint on fol.23b
Green paint is also employed on foll.23b and 24a.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
Added generic msItem title(s) based on ancestor title
Missing a cross shape in Part 2, addition 2.
Changed: Files moved to srophe-app-data/data/manuscripts/tei repository.
